message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with list-decoding of Reed-Solomon codes, which is a topic in coding theory and information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also uses combinatorial techniques such as the generalized Singleton bound and cycle space from Graph Theory, which suggests that it could also be classified under cs.DS (Discrete Mathematics), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), and cs.CG (Computational Geometry). Finally, the paper introduces a new type of linear dependency between codewords, which could potentially fall under cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics).
